verses.text: Rejoice in the \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*, O ye righteous: forpraise is comely for the upright.
Praise the \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*with harp: sing unto him with the psaltery andan instrument of ten strings.
Sing unto him a new song; play skilfully with a loud noise.
For the word of the \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*isright; and all his works are donein truth.
He loveth righteousness and judgment: the earth is full of the goodness of the \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*.
By the word of the \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*were the heavens made; and all the host of them by the breath of his mouth.
He gathereth the waters of the sea together as an heap: he layeth up the depth in storehouses.
Let all the earth fear the \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*: let all the inhabitants of the world stand in awe of him.
For he spake, and it was done;he commanded, and it stood fast.
The \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*bringeth the counsel of the heathen to nought: he maketh the devices of the people of none effect.
The counsel of the \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*standeth for ever, the thoughts of his heart to all generations.
Blessed isthe nation whose God isthe \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*; andthe people whomhe hath chosen for his own inheritance.
The \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*looketh from heaven; he beholdeth all the sons of men.
From the place of his habitation he looketh upon all the inhabitants of the earth.
He fashioneth their hearts alike; he considereth all their works.
There is no king saved by the multitude of an host: a mighty man is not delivered by much strength.
An horse isa vain thing for safety: neither shall he deliver anyby his great strength.
Behold, the eye of the \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*isupon them that fear him, upon them that hope in his mercy;
To deliver their soul from death, and to keep them alive in famine.
Our soul waiteth for the \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*: he isour help and our shield.
For our heart shall rejoice in him, because we have trusted in his holy name.
Let thy mercy, O \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*, be upon us, according as we hope in thee.
